template_name: FIR Template for Property Forgery Cases

format.subject: FIR under Sections 420, 467, 468, 471, 120B IPC for Forgery of Will and Property Fraud

co_accused.name: [Any official who helped]
co_accused.role: Municipal/Revenue official who processed illegal mutation

facts_of_case: 1. My father [Name] and mother [Name] died intestate (without will) on [Date].
2. As per Hindu Succession Act, 1956, Section 8, all Class I heirs (myself, my brother [Name], my sister [Name]) have equal rights in the ancestral property located at [Address].
3. On [Date], I discovered that accused [Name] has fraudulently obtained mutation of the said property in her name.
4. The mutation was done on the basis of a forged will purportedly executed by my late father on [Date].
5. The signature on the will does not match my father's genuine signature. [Attach sample signatures if available]
6. My father never executed any will, and we (legal heirs) never consented to this transfer.
7. The accused obtained mutation entry No. [X] from [Municipal/Revenue Office] by submitting the forged will.
8. This amounts to cheating under Section 420 IPC and forgery under Sections 467, 468, 471 IPC.
9. The accused acted in criminal conspiracy with [co-accused names] to defraud legal heirs.

sections_invoked.420: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property (Punishment: 7 years + fine)
sections_invoked.467: Forgery of valuable security, will, or authority to make/transfer property (Punishment: Life imprisonment or 10 years + fine)
sections_invoked.468: Forgery for purpose of cheating (Punishment: 7 years + fine)
sections_invoked.471: Using as genuine a forged document (Punishment: As per Section 467)
sections_invoked.120B: Criminal conspiracy (Punishment: Same as substantive offense)

prayer_relief: 1. Kindly register FIR against the accused under Sections 420, 467, 468, 471, 120B IPC.
2. Conduct thorough investigation and arrest the accused.
3. Seize the forged will and all related documents as evidence.
4. Conduct forensic handwriting examination to prove forgery.
5. Interrogate attesting witnesses and municipal officials involved.
6. Inform District Registrar and Revenue Office about pending criminal case to freeze further transactions.
7. File charge sheet and prosecute accused to the fullest extent of law.
format.verification: I, [Your Name], solemnly affirm that the above facts are true to the best of my knowledge and belief.

supporting_documents: Copy of death certificates of parents
Family tree / birth certificates proving Class I heirship
Sample signatures of deceased father for comparison
Affidavits from family members stating no will was executed

legal_notes.cognizability: Section 467 is cognizable and non-bailable. Police must register FIR without delay.
legal_notes.jurisdiction: Police station within whose jurisdiction the property is located OR where forgery occurred.
legal_notes.section_156_3: If police refuses to register FIR, approach Magistrate under Section 156(3) CrPC for direction to police to investigate.
legal_notes.zero_fir: If unsure of jurisdiction, file Zero FIR at any police station, which will be transferred to correct jurisdiction.
legal_notes.time_limit: No limitation period for filing FIR in cognizable offenses.
